newsitem.title: USA: Richmond Fed--Jan manufacturing, services indexes.
newsitem.headline: Richmond Fed--Jan manufacturing, services indexes.

text.p: Federal Reserve Bank of Richmond indexes monitoring manufacturing and service-sector
The increase in the services-sector revenues index was not typical for January.

"For the past three years, the average change in the index of service-sector revenues has been a 30-point decline from December to January," the Richmond Fed said in its survey. "However, this January the index rose seven points."
Richmond Federal Reserve economist Raymond Owens said respondents to the surveys reported "very modest" price rises but no significant price pressures.

"Respondents to these surveys have been reporting very modest price increases for some time now, perhaps too modest in the context of what we see in the real world," Owens said in an interview with Reuters Financial Television.

"But nevertheless their predictions of very modest price increases month-to-month do perhaps mimic what we see in the overall in the economy rather well," he added. "At this point they are not reporting any significant increase in price pressures."
